oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EXPERIENCES ON DIFFERENT TYPES OF ON-FARM RESEARCH IN EASTERN FINLAND
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nykänen, Arja
Kurki, Päivi
Rinne, Marketta
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pasture and forage crops
Cereals, pulses and oilseeds
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In Finland, as well as in many other countries, on-farm research is becoming more and more common. The reasons are many-fold. Agricultural research stations are closed down due to economical constraints and researchers want to have ‘real data’ from the farms. Advisors see on-farm research as a new and efficient tool to show farmers good practices in their production. In addition, for farmers it is an attractive way of testing suitable farming practices in the environment of their own farm.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Nykänen, Arja; Kurki, Päivi and Rinne, Marketta (2014) EXPERIENCES ON DIFFERENT TYPES OF ON-FARM RESEARCH IN EASTERN FINLAND. In: Rahmann, G. and Aksoy, U. (Eds.) Building Organic Bridges, Johann Heinrich von Thünen-Institut, Braunschweig, Germany, 1, Thuenen Report, no. 20, pp. 255-258.
